message.content:
cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.GT, cs.MA, cs.SY 

The paper deals with the application of reinforcement learning to stochastic games, which is a subfield of artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The use of neural networks in the experiments suggests that the paper may also fall under the category of machine learning (cs.LG). The paper also discusses game theory concepts such as team games and zero-sum games, indicating that it may belong to the subfield of game theory (cs.GT). Additionally, the paper deals with multiple agents interacting strategically, which falls under the category of multi-agent systems (cs.MA). Finally, the paper discusses the balancing of games, which is a control problem and may fall under the category of control systems (cs.SY).
